Job Title: Contracts Administrator

Location: Boise, ID

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!

When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.

Job Description

When details make the difference, the difference is having you!

We value people who appreciate what others may dismiss as “the small stuff.” If there’s a way to fine tune to improve accuracy, you’ll find it. Your keen observational skills and extraordinary work ethic are what make you such a valuable employee to us. When you’re responsible for the job, nothing slips through your fingers. Please don’t slip through ours.

Parsons is the premier choice for world-class design, engineering, and construction services.

Parsons is now hiring an experienced Contract Administrator to support a new manufacturing facility in Boise, ID.

Key Experience Or Attributes Required

Reviews client contracts to identify risks and to ensure conformity to client policies and procedures.Drafts contracts for large engineering/construction management projects.Proposes alternative text/clauses to client contracts, as appropriate for the client.Ensures that the contract and any changes are thoroughly reviewed for legal, risk management, and accounting issues prior to submitting to management for approval. This includes coordination with appropriate client’s business groups.Lead the efforts with coordinating, organizing, and securing change documents with Project Managers. Aide Project Team with change documents for completeness and accuracy. Lead in maintaining and managing change logs in company systems. Assist in preparation of written communications on technical and non-technical matters for various levels of management. Provide support to project teams in tracking all management of change (MOC) related process changes. Help in gathering data and prepare supporting documentation during both Engineering and Construction phases of a project. Organizing and tracking of documents as they go through the approval process, make sure signed forms are gathered, and saved for auditing purposes. Participates as a member of the negotiating team, consisting of business development and project management personnel, for establishing business terms and contract conditions.Monitors and administers the business provisions of prime contracts to ensure compliance with contractual terms and conditions.Advises the Contracts Manager and any appropriate Project Managers regarding scope, financial, and risk issues of prime contracts.May be responsible for overseeing a significant portion of the contract administration activities within designated market areas.Solves significant prime contract problems, taking independent action as prescribed by project procedures.Provides guidance and direction to junior Contract Administrators, as appropriate.Provide contract review and support for the standardization of the client’s general provisions and front-end contracts.Closeout SupportProvide project management support of closeout documentation for final acceptance by the Client.Provide closeout updates, in Smartsheet, to the infrastructure team regarding each individual project closeout status.Provide support for review of invoices and project schedule of values as required by the project team and audit.Provide additional support to the Project Controls team as required.


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Finance, or related field.5+ years of prime contract administration experience is required.Requires a thorough knowledge of industry business practices and the negotiation of prime contracts.


Minimum Clearance Required To Start

Not Applicable/None

This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.

For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.

Salary Range

$83,300.00 - $145,800.00

We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!

Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.

We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
